Description: Painted sycomore fig(?) wood shabti of Tamy with a black lappet-wig with yellow braids, a yellow face with black eyes and red lips, a yellow and red collar fringed with black, yellow hands outlined in red with black and yellow bracelets and depicted holding two black hoes, the legs are inscribed with four rows of black painted hieroglyphs on a yellow ground separated by red lines, there is a similar central column of hieroglyphs at the back, the feet and body are white, the back is decorated with a representation of a red seed-basket and a red yoke with two pendular nu-pots.
